page.title: 02 WOKINGHAM'S LOCAL STREAM
page.content: The local{stream}near our school of{ {St.Paul's}is called the{Emmbrook.}This is an interesting part of our{local {history.}It rises to the{S.E. of {Wokingham}and flows into the{Loddon {River,}which then flows into the{ {Thames. Once there was a{tanhouse}on the Emm near Barkham Road,Wokingham which tanned leather.About a mile downstream from the{tanhouse}was a{cornmill, which was pulled down in this century.Flats were built but the cornmill is remembered because the flats are called{"Mill Close".} A long time ago farmers used to cut off the branches of the willows growing on its banks(called pollarding)and sell them or make fences from them.Now the{Water Board} cut the branches in case they fall in the brook and dam it,causing flooding.
